1.point: React is developed and maintained by developers from FaceBook, Instagram and a small community of developers from other organizations

2.point: The initial release of React was in March 2013, which would make it three years old

3.point: React is FaceBooks top repository by over tens-of-thousands of stars and is currently the fifth most starred repository on all of GitHub (only two-thousand stars ahead of Angular.js)

1.point: React is an open-source JavaScript library which renders data as HTML

2.point: React operates off of a 'data tree', which essentially boils down to passing data between 'reusable components'

3.point: To expand on 'reusable components', the best example would be a button component

4.point: We utilize 'props' to pass data around the tree, which will manipulate the button as required

5.point: We can also use 'PropTypes' to specify what we expect for the component ('isRequired' can specifically throw a console error if rules aren't followed)

6.point: 'Reusable components' should be kept as small as possible; if they serve more than one purpose create a new component

8.point: Since component logic is written in JavaScript instead of templates you can easily pass rich data through your app and keep state out of the DOM.

1.point: You can take advantage of 'state', which will allow for the DOM to rerender every time a components state changes

2.point: This can be really powerful when handling DOM changes

3.point: In its simplest form React will allow for a cleaner, more efficient and much faster application than a plain HTML application
